is a small, fairly quiet college and agricultural town in
. Home of Eastern New Mexico University. Nearest sizable town is
; close to Cannon Air Force Base. Located almost adjacent to the

(Staked Plains) in extreme eastern New Mexico, at the junction of US 70, NM 206 and NM 267.  These roads are all good but rather remote, and can be troublesome during winter blizzards.  The nearest air service is via commuter lines into the airport at Clovis, about 15 miles away.

value: has the usual small-college features, and maintains two museums: Blackwater Draw Museum off US 70, which preserves artifacts from a nearby archaeological site of some significance, and Roosevelt County Museum on campus, with the usual collection of items of local historical interest.

content=The archaeological site associated with ENMU's museum (see above), is available for visits during much of the year. Open 9-5 daily between Memorial Day and Labor Day; closed November-March; 9-5 Sa-Su other months. Fee $3, several discounts apply. There are a couple of short interpretive trails.
